sections.title: Second: Service Challenges and Baseline
sections.content:
Second: Service Challenges and Baseline

The entities covered by the Abu Dhabi policy for effortless customer experience must identify and study the challenges of strategic and priority services, and determine the current status of their performance  before  starting  the  re-designing  process,  through:

· Using different research methods and scientific and objective analysis methods.

· Relying  on  comprehensive,  reliable, and  up-to-  date  data  and appropriate  scientific  tools,  such  as  a  tool  for  drawing  customer experience  and  comparisons  with  best  practices.

· Studying the current and future needs and expectations of customers through the various service channels.

· What are the Components of Action Plans for Priority Improvement?

sections.title: This stage of the design process is primarily intended to:
sections.content:
This stage of the design process is primarily intended to:

1. Studying the service to be improved by identifying  the stakeholders, the  customer segments who benefit from the service, the methods of applying for the service, the systems used to complete the service, and the nature of the outputs.

2. Understanding the different service challenges and the reasons behind these challenges.

3. Studying  the  current  service  performance  using  quantitative  and qualitative  analysis  of  service  data.
hierarchy: This stage of the design process is primarily intended to:

sections.title: How To Define Service Challenges
sections.content:
How To Define Service Challenges

The design team typically engages in a range of activities that help them understand service challenges, for example:

· Understand the customer's journey to obtain the service and analyse their different behaviour and sentiments  across the different touch points.

· Review  customers' complaints  and  suggestions  to  obtain  effective information  about  the customer's needs.

· Understand the actual drivers of customer behaviour to reach a deeper understanding of service challenges.

· Understand the impact of employees and strategic partners on service performance.

sections.title: Qualitative  Data
sections.content:
Qualitative  Data

Qualitative data research helps service designers identify service challenges by identifying the true needs and desires of  customers. It also directs the efforts of service designers toward developing a deep understanding of customers' behaviours, expectations, pain, and motives.

Qualitative data research is of an exploratory nature and is concerned with collecting data through direct and indirect meetings with customers as individuals or groups.

The qualitative data collection tools and techniques used  by  designers and  researchers  vary,  and  the choice of data collection method affects the effectiveness of the research and exploration process to understand service  challenges.

When  qualitative research is implemented  effectively, its results successfully  highlight  service challenges and lead to an understanding  of undiscovered  customer  needs  that  are  essential  inputs  to  the  design process.

sections.title: Here are some of the tools and techniques that can be used to collect qualitative data:
sections.content:
Here are some of the tools and techniques that can be used to collect qualitative data:

· Open-ended questions in the questionnaires

· Interviews with the customers

· Focus groups.

· Observational studies

· Reference comparisons
hierarchy: Here are some of the tools and techniques that can be used to collect qualitative data:

sections.title: Quantitative Data
sections.content:
Quantitative Data

Quantitative data collection tools and  techniques were used to obtain a general and statistical perception of the service challenges and the nature of the customer. Techniques for collecting quantitative data include:

· Quantitative questionnaires

· Quantitative observational studies

· Experiments

sections.title: Quantitative data is essential for service designers because it:
sections.content:
Quantitative data is essential for service designers because it:

· Determines the service baseline.

· Measures  the  progress  in  service  performance  after  implementing transformation  initiatives.
hierarchy: Quantitative data is essential for service designers because it:

sections.title: Drawing a Customer Journey Map
sections.content:
Drawing a Customer Journey Map

Mapping the customer journey is an important process for understanding how customers interact with the service. This is done through:

· Visually  recording  all  touchpoints  that  the  customer  goes  through when receiving the service which includes before, during, and after communicating  with  the  service  provider.

· Analysing the customers' behaviours and interactions across the various touchpoints.

· Taking into consideration all the scenarios that the customer may go through  or  the  different  customer  segments.

· Taking into consideration all cases in which the customer may fail to apply for  the service,  and  the  necessary  steps  to overcome that.

sections.title: Defining Challenges
sections.content:
Defining Challenges

The main challenges of the service are defined by understanding all the information  collected  during  the  drawing  of  the  customer's  journey  or when  studying  the  quantitative  and  qualitative  data  of  the  service.

It  is  necessary that  the design  team  correctly frame the challenges by approaching  and  organizing  service  information  through  a  scientific approach. It is also necessary that the service challenges accurately reflect their  reality.

sections.title: Framing the service challenges must be:
sections.content:
Framing the service challenges must be:

· Brief and clear

· Based on real inputs and not based on hypotheses

· Implementable across specific courses of action
hierarchy: Framing the service challenges must be:

sections.title: Service Baseline
sections.content:
Service Baseline

It is essential that the design team define  a baseline for the service during and when they have identified its challenges. The baseline can express the following measurements:

· Number of affected customers/beneficiaries of the service

· The number of service transactions

· The carrying capacity of the delivery channels.

· The current demand for the service

· Customers' impressions of the service

· Employee productivity

· The unit cost of the service

· The total cost of the service

· Service time

· The number of steps to provide the service

· The number of documents required to obtain the service.

sections.title: Third: Ideation
sections.content:
Third: Ideation

The  entities  covered  by  the  Abu  Dhabi  policy  for  effortless  customer experience must use the methods and tools of sequential creative thinking to  propose  appropriate  ideas  and  scenarios  for  the  development of services,  strategies,  and  priority services while taking into consideration the opinions of customers and in cooperation with strategic partners from the public and private sectors. This shall be done in a manner that harnesses modern and pioneering technologies to serve customers.

The entities covered by this policy must also launch strategic initiatives that transform strategic and priority services to become easy, accessible, and effortless, taking into account the fulfilment of the needs of all customer segments through various channels.

sections.content: The Importance of Effective Idea Generation Sessions
hierarchy: The Importance of Effective Idea Generation Sessions

sections.title: The  importance  of  the  idea  generation  stage  lies  in  the  following points:
sections.content:
The  importance  of  the  idea  generation  stage  lies  in  the  following points:

· Forming an inclusive grouping of service designers,  stakeholders,  and customers with  the aim of offering solutions in a differentiated manner that explores a wide range of design alternatives.

· Creating an open space for discussing, filtering, and constantly revising ideas.

· Attaining  a  wide  range  of  ideas  that  service  designers  will  test  and prototype.

· Providing an opportunity that brings together unique  perspectives, leading  to  comprehensive solutions with the help of an experienced supervisor.

· Holding idea generation sessions to reveal unexpected aspects of the problem  that  need  further  investigation  and  help  move  the  team beyond  choosing  clear  solutions.  This  helps  in  stimulating  creative thinking so that a set of the most innovative ideas is reached and to eventually  proceed  to  the  prototyping  stage.
hierarchy: The  importance  of  the  idea  generation  stage  lies  in  the  following points:

sections.title: The Role of the Facilitator in the Idea Generation Sessions
sections.content:
The Role of the Facilitator in the Idea Generation Sessions

The  process  of  generating  ideas  takes  place  through  holding  sessions headed by an experienced  facilitator who is keen to achieve the desired goal by the end of the session.
hierarchy: The Role of the Facilitator in the Idea Generation Sessions

sections.title: Responsibilities of the facilitator during idea- generation sessions:
sections.content:
Responsibilities of the facilitator during idea- generation sessions:

· Effectively  overseeing  sessions  by  understanding  and managing diverse  teams,  personalities,  and  dynamics.

· Ensuring the involvement of the various elements that create the ideal environment  and  mindset,  and  the  appropriate  state  to  achieve maximum  benefit  from  the  participants  in  generating  ideas  and increase  the  chance  of  achieving  a  productive  session.

· Exploiting environments that stimulate the flow of creative ideas; there is nothing better than participating in an idea generation session that takes you literally and figuratively out of the ordinary. Research shows that  inspiring  spaces can have a significant impact on  the  creative state of a design team, so it is advised to avoid holding sessions in the usual places such as meeting rooms. Instead, a stimulating environment that helps foster innovative ways of thinking should be chosen.

· Providing  a  safe  environment  for  open  and  creative  thinking.  An experienced facilitator ensures a comfortable environment in which participants  have  the  ability  to  exchange  innovative  ideas  and  ask thought-provoking  questions.

The most important tasks of the idea generation sessions are:

· Generate and evaluate ideas.

sections.title: Important Guidelines for Brainstorming
sections.content: Important Guidelines for Brainstorming

sections.title: The most important tasks of the idea generation sessions are:
sections.content:
The most important tasks of the idea generation sessions are:

· This stage is carried out in a smooth manner to facilitate the creative thinking  process and to allow all stakeholders to contribute to sharing their ideas and solutions, no matter how small or large they are.

· Certain  tools  and  techniques  can  also  be  used  during  this  stage  to facilitate creative  thinking (such as brainstorming or brainstorming using  games)  and  other  tools.

· It is important to prepare for the process of brainstorming by providing an appropriate environment that motivates all participants to propose solutions and creative ideas without hesitation.

· The  process  of  brainstorming  should  also  be  prepared  by  using techniques that have proven to be effective in motivating participants to  propose as  many  ideas  as  possible  and  assure  ideas  flow  in a smooth  and  creative  way.

· It is essential to focus on the challenges agreed upon in the previous phase of the design methodology to ensure that the idea- generation sessions are effective, and their objectives are achieved. This is to make sure that the ideas put forward are directed in the right context.

· It  is  also  very  important  to  manage  the  sessions  to  ensure  that all the  ideas  put  forward  are  taken  into  account  and  to  give  equal opportunities to all participants to express their opinions and ideas on how to overcome the challenge that was  reached and agreed upon in the  previous  stages.

· It is important to avoid rejecting the ideas presented  by  the  team, encouraging the team to put forward different ideas, and removing any feeling of hesitation or fear of participation.

· Always keep a record of the ideas and interventions  that  are  put forward. This contributes to understanding the overall perception of the ideas and solutions presented.

· It is also important to encourage the team to generate a vast number of  ideas  because  the quantity of ideas at this stage is more important than their quality.
hierarchy: The most important tasks of the idea generation sessions are:

sections.title: Evaluation of Ideas and Selection of Initiatives
sections.content:
Evaluation of Ideas and Selection of Initiatives

The brainstorming step ends with a long list of potential solutions that the design team has agreed  that their implementation would contribute to addressing the challenges identified in the previous design stages.

This step aims to study and purify this long list and reduce the number of alternatives by defining and evaluating solutions that have practical and scientific strength to be further developed and enriched.

This  step  is  characterized  by  repetition  until  the  team  reaches  an agreement on the solutions selected for implementation. Typically, during this step, the team:

· Applies a specific evaluation matrix that studies the extent to which the  proposed  solutions  address  service  challenges  and  the  extent to which the proposed solutions are easy to implement. It is usually advised to start with the easiest solutions and then gradually apply more complex solutions to achieve quick success for the service and prepare  the  work  teams  and  resources  needed  for  more  complex solutions  that  require  more  time  and  resources.

· Conducts rapid prototyping to experiment with different solutions.

· Applies  a  series  of  tests  to  improve  the  proposed  solutions  in preparation  for  their  selection.
hierarchy: Evaluation of Ideas and Selection of Initiatives

sections.title: Fourth: Visualize the Future State of the Customer's Experience
sections.content:
Fourth: Visualize the Future State of the Customer's Experience

· It is necessary to reimagine the customer experiences when obtaining the service after implementing the improvement initiatives that were agreed upon in the previous stages.

· This step should be implemented with a balanced consideration of the involved customer segments.

· The future customer experience should be visualized from start to end including all customer touchpoints, required, documents, etc.

· It is necessary to identify the most vital metrics for the future customer experience so that their performance is monitored periodically.

· The future customer experience should be visualized across all possible channels including emerging channels, such as text messages, social media, and online chats.

sections.title: How are Customers Segmented?
sections.content:
How are Customers Segmented?

The segmentation of customers is the first and most important step that helps entities understand and manage their relationship with customers. This  process  helps  entities  understand  the  needs  of  various  customer segments and makes it easier to  reach them.

It is possible to divide the customer base into groups or segments according to distinctive characteristics  so  that  customers  of  each  segment  are similar in specific characteristics such as demographic, behavioural, or  social  characteristics,  as  well  as others.

Classifying customers according to defined characteristics allows entities to target each of these groups to ensure that the needs and expectations of its customers are met.

Customers can be differentiated and categorized on  a  set  of  basic characteristics,  examples  of which are demonstrated below:

sections.title: What are the Main Criteria for Service Delivery?
sections.content:
What are the Main Criteria for Service Delivery?

This dimension provides fundamental and essential criteria to be considered when  delivering  services  to  customers  through  the  various  channels provided by the entity. It serves as a reference that helps the entity and its employees respond quickly and effectively to its customers to maintain a high level of professionalism during service delivery across all delivery channels.

These  standards  are  central  to  creating  a  holistic  customer  experience through a focus on various dimensions that reflect the quality-of-service delivery.

· The speed of service delivery

· Accessibility of the service

· Quality of service information

· Customer privacy

sections.content:
What are the Criteria for Service Delivery at Service Centres (Which Requires the Physical Presence of the Customer)?

Personal interaction with customers requires the customer to be physically available at the service centres provided by entities. It is therefore essential to adhere to a set of criteria that help achieve an exceptional experience for customers who prefer to physically avail a service.

Navigation

· The correct address of the service centre locations appears when searching for it on Google Maps.

· There should be a lack of obstacles on the road leading to the entrance of the service centre to ensure it is clear for people of determination.

· The facilities inside the buildings and at the entrance are easily accessible for people of determination.

Building Interiors

· The restrooms should be available for use and well-maintained.

· The reception should be well equipped to facilitate people of determination.

· There are restrooms designated for people of determination.

· There are clear signs that provide directions to various departments and facilities

(For example: restrooms, prayer room, etc.).

· There is a prayer area available and is well- maintained.

Queueing System

Writing Hall

whether paid or for free.

sections.title: 03 Professionalism of CX Agents
sections.content:
03 Professionalism of CX Agents

CX agents (For example: receptionists and customer service staff) are essential for providing an effortless customer experience. There  are therefore  standards  in place for them to adhere to during service delivery:

· Effective communication by smiling and welcoming  the customer and using a friendly tone of voice (For example: start by saying a greeting such as (For example: 'Peace be  upon you,' 'Good morning,' or 'Welcome to.'). This is done to give the customer a good impression of the entity providing the service.

· The use of clear and coherent language when speaking to the customer.

· The customer must be given full attention and consideration; avoid being preoccupied (For example: using or talking on a mobile phone, except in times of utmost necessity). The customer's permission must be  sought  before  being  preoccupied  with  anything  else.

· Appearance: CX agents should adhere to a professional  dress  code, neat  appearance,  and maintain personal hygiene.

· Eye contact: CX agents must build a good rapport with the customer and make them aware of their importance.

· Taking the initiative to assist the customer: expediting the assistance of customers and promptly providing them with the correct information.

· Upon  completion  of  the  service,  it  must  be  ensured  that  all  the customer's needs are met by inquiring if there is anything else that can be  provided,  then  thanking  and  bidding  them  farewell.

sections.title: During Service Delivery:
sections.content:
During Service Delivery:

· Understanding the needs of customers' requirements and effectively communicating and listening well to their feedback and  needs and avoiding interrupting them. In case the customer's requirement is not clear, it is necessary to verify their request again and wait for the customer's confirmation  or  correction.

· Correctly clarifying the requirements related to the customer's request.

· Explaining to the customer the steps taken to solve the problem in case any problem arises. If the customer is not satisfied with the solution, suggest alternative solutions until a consensus is reached.

· In the event that the customer's request is not in the scope of a service representative's  duties  or  if  a  problem  requires  transferring  the customer to another employee, avoid saying 'this is not within my work mandate'. Apologize  to  the customer and explain the protocol for  request  transfers.

sections.title: Most Important General Standards that must be adhered to by CX agents:
sections.content:
Most Important General Standards that must be adhered to by CX agents:

· Availability of reception staff during working hours.

· Ability to speak more than one of the preferred languages (Arabic / English).

· Ability to redirect the customer to the appropriate person to process their  request.

· Commitment to raising any challenges faced during service delivery.

· Commitment to clarifying the conditions related to service applications and  the  potential  need  for  customers  to  avail  another  service beforehand.

· Keenness to highlight the positive role of the customer in contributing to the development of services and providing professional  services that meet aspirations.

· Wearing a job card displaying the employee's name.

· Giving the customer full attention.

· Apologize to the customer in case a transaction is intercepted.

· Addressing customers with respect.

· Going the extra mile when providing the service.

· Familiarity with information about the service and the ability to answer all related questions.

· Providing  posters  or  signs  indicating  the  existence  of  a  complaint system.

· Offering multiple payment options.

· Promoting the services available through alternative digital channels.

· Promoting electronic services as an alternative during service delivery by the CX agent.

· Respecting the privacy of the customer.

· Ability of the receptionist to direct customers and answer their inquiries.

· Ability of the receptionist to display full interest in the customer.

· Introducing customers to the customer's charter.

· Commitment to the specified service delivery time.

· Assisting  and  training  the  customer  to  submit  applications  through digital channels, if available, from the mobile phone during their visit to the service centre.

· Ability to contact a digital customer service representative on the first try.

sections.title: 04 Ease of Completing the Service
sections.content:
04 Ease of Completing the Service

· Giving priority and extra attention to people of determination.

· Providing a special device (iPad or laptop) for customers to submit applications.

· Displaying the centre 's services on the screens (if any).

· Recording complaints/suggestions

· Number of steps for availing the service at the service centre are few and does not require much effort from the customer.

· Service submission forms are free from errors or duplicate fields.

· Providing service information in the language preferred by the customer.

· Obtaining all information requested from CX agents on the first attempt.

· Employee's ability to serve people of determination.

· Providing free internet (Wi-Fi) at the service centre.

· Providing assistance to customers  who  do not have an Emirates ID on how to proceed.

· Providing a common screen between the employee and the customer so that the customer can see what the employee is doing to complete the service.

sections.title: What are the Criteria for Providing Services Over the Phone?
sections.content:
What are the Criteria for Providing Services Over the Phone?

Many customers prefer this method of applying for the service  as  it  does not  require  physical  attendance, and is, therefore, easier and requires less effort and time.

The entity must ensure that the following criteria related to the phone delivery  channel  are  met.
hierarchy: What are the Criteria for Providing Services Over the Phone?

sections.title: 01 The Speed of Service Delivery
sections.content:
01 The Speed of Service Delivery

· Responding to calls quickly so that calls are answered in less than 20 seconds, or the number of rings does not exceed 3 rings.

· Not putting the customer on hold for more than a minute.

sections.title: 02 Ease of Access to the Service
sections.content: 02 Ease of Access to the Service
hierarchy: 02 Ease of Access to the Service

sections.title: Answer Machine
sections.content:
Answer Machine

· Availability of an automated answering system.

· Ease of navigation between the answering machine options.

· The answering machine options are sufficient to select the desired service.

· Opening hours are mentioned on the answering machine.

· The automated answering machine must ask the customer whether they applied for the service through the website or not. This should happen  before  the  call  is  redirected  to  the  CX  agent.

· Notifying customers in the event of a system malfunction through the automated answering machine.

· Adding a WhatsApp number for customers to contact customer service.

sections.title: Reaching the CX Agent
sections.content:
Reaching the CX Agent

· Easily finding the contact numbers of the entity over the phone through the first search process.

· Contacting  the  selected  employee/department via the answering machine.

· Reaching the CX agent on the first try.

· Providing a queuing system (so that it informs the customer how many customers are waiting in line).

· Communicating with the customer in their preferred language.

sections.title: 03 Professionalism of CX Agents
sections.content:
03 Professionalism of CX Agents

· Receiving calls  by  greeting  the  customer (For example: 'Peace be upon you,' 'Good morning,' or 'Welcome to.').

· Introducing themselves to the customer.

· Asking the customers to identify themselves.

· Addressing the customer by their name or title (such as sir/madam) throughout  the  entire  conversation.

· Using a moderate, clear, and  friendly tone while speaking with the customer and avoid raising the tone of voice even if the customer is angry.

· Speaking with the customer clearly and at a pace that can be easily understood.

· Listening and understanding the customer's requirements to provide the service effectively. In the case that a customer has faced a problem, listening well to the customer contributes to effectively identifying the problem and finding the best solutions.

· Asking  the  customers  questions  related  to  their  request  to  better understand  their  inquiry.

· Avoid interrupting the customer while they are speaking.

· Correctly  explaining  the  requirements  related  to  the customer's request.

· Asking  the  customer  about  their  preferred  channel  of  receiving information.

· The CX agent must be fluent in the most frequently used languages according  to  the  customer  segments  that  have  been  classified.

sections.title: 3.1 If you require placing the customer on hold, make sure to:
sections.content:
3.1 If you require placing the customer on hold, make sure to:

· Know how to put the customer on hold.

· Receive the customer's approval before putting them on hold.

· Clearly explain to the customer the reasons for putting them on hold.

· Inform the customer of the waiting period.

· Thank the customer for waiting.

· Not put the customer on hold for a long time, and if necessary, return to the customer and apologize for the delay.

· Not put the customer on hold more than once.

· Assure to refer to the information that is related to the customer's request  after  placing  them  on  hold.
hierarchy: 3.1 If you require placing the customer on hold, make sure to:

sections.title: 3.2 Before you end the call, make sure to:
sections.content:
3.2 Before you end the call, make sure to:

· Know how to put the customer on hold.

· Verify that the customer's request has been completed and inform the  customer  if  there  are  any  updates  regarding  the  status  of  the application  after  the  service  has  been  delivered.

· Ask the customer if there are any other services that they would like to apply for after the service has been delivered.

· Promote  digital  services  as  a  service  channel  alternative  upon completion  of  the  service  over  the  phone.

· Tactfully bid farewell to the customer using the appropriate phrases before the end of the call, (For example: 'Thank you for calling. Have a nice  day/evening.  Goodbye .' ).
hierarchy: 3.2 Before you end the call, make sure to:

sections.title: 04 Ease of Completing the Service
sections.content:
04 Ease of Completing the Service

· Understanding the customer's needs from the first time.

· Providing the customer with a request/reference number to help them follow up with their request, or informing the customer that they will receive a message with their request number.

· Reminding the customer of the next service steps (in case the request is not resolved).

· Asking the customer about their preferred channel of communication.

· Availability of information through the customer's preferred channel.

· Guiding customers who do not have an Emirates ID on how to proceed.

· Directing  and  advising  the  customer  by  providing  information  or clarification regarding the documents needed to apply for a service.

· Responding to the inquiry / solving the problem by the CX agent from the first contact.

· Sending a questionnaire as soon as the call is completed and informing the customer of the questionnaire.

sections.title: In  case  of  forwarding  calls,  the  following  criteria must be adhered to:
sections.content:

· Being knowledgeable on how to forward calls.

· Availability of a CX agent to answer the forwarded calls.

· Provide the customer with brief information about their request.

· Not to forward the customer more than once.

· The call is forwarded to the correct department/employee.

· Providing information related to the customer's inquiry.
hierarchy: In  case  of  forwarding  calls,  the  following  criteria must be adhered to:

sections.title: In case a customer requires a call back, make sure to:
sections.content:
In case a customer requires a call back, make sure to:

· Inform the customer of the time of the call back.

· Commit to the agreed time to re-contact with the customer.

· Provide  complete information regarding the customer's inquiry.
hierarchy: In case a customer requires a call back, make sure to:

sections.title: 05 The Quality of Service Information
sections.content:

· The information provided about the requested  service is consistent with the information available  on the website.

· Provide accurate/sufficient information to process  the request.

· Explain service steps in a clear and understandable manner for the customer.

sections.content:

· Inform the customer that the call is recorded for quality or training purposes.

sections.title: 03 Professionalism of CX Agents

sections.content:

sections.title: 06 The Appearance of the Service Delivery Environment
sections.content:

What are the Criteria for Providing the Service through WhatsApp?

The entity should follow the below criteria related to delivering services through  WhatsApp.
hierarchy: What are the Criteria for Providing the Service through WhatsApp?

sections.title: 01 The Speed of Service Delivery
sections.content:
01 The Speed of Service Delivery

· The  CX  agent  should  not  exceed  the  time  required  to  start  the conversation  via WhatsApp.

· The CX agent should not exceed the time required to provide assistance and resolve the customer's inquiry through WhatsApp.

· Delays  or  temporary  suspension  of  the  service  by  the  CX  agent  in WhatsApp  should  not  exceed  45  seconds.

sections.title: 02 Ease of Access to the Service
sections.content:
02 Ease of Access to the Service

· The  customer  can  easily  find  the  option  to  communicate  through WhatsApp.

· The image used in WhatsApp should be suitable for the entity.

· The profile of the entity on WhatsApp should include the necessary information  regarding the  entity,  such  as  the  entity's  information, contact  number,  website,  email,  and  others.
hierarchy: 02 Ease of Access to the Service

sections.title: 03 The Professionalism of Frontline Staff
sections.content:
03 The Professionalism of Frontline Staff

· The CX agents should be available to respond to customer inquiries through  WhatsApp

· The  CX  agents  should  greet  the  customer  using  the  appropriate standard  phrases  through  WhatsApp.

· The CX agent should have the ability to communicate in the language preferred by the customer (Arabic or English).

· The CX agent should use language that is easy to understand and clear to the customer through WhatsApp.

· The response of the CX agent should be free of spelling or grammatical errors through WhatsApp.

· The CX agent should understand the full requirements of the customer through WhatsApp.

· The  CX  agents  on  WhatsApp  should  be  keen  to  provide  all  of  the required information or direct the customer to the appropriate link to obtain  the  required  information  related  to  their  inquiry.

· In the event of a delay in response through WhatsApp,  the  CX  agent must  apologize  to  the customer.

· After assisting the customer through WhatsApp, the CX agent must ask the customer if they require further assistance.

· The  CX  agent  must  follow  the  standards/protocol  of  ending  the conversation  on  WhatsApp.

· The CX agent must provide advice and assistance in the chat room  on how to proceed with the application, the procedures, the required documents, and all related information to customers who do not have an Emirates ID.

· The CX agent must ensure and be willing to provide all the required information  that  the  customer  needs  through  WhatsApp.

sections.title: 04 The Quality of Service Information
sections.content:
04 The Quality of Service Information

· The CX agent must provide all the information related to the requested service  through  WhatsApp,  such  as  the  procedures  and  steps for  applying,  service  fees,  time  to  apply  for  the  service,  required documents,  available  channels  to  apply for the service, and others.

· The  information  provided  by  the  CX  agent  through  the  WhatsApp application  agrees  with  the  information  available  on  the  entity's website.

· Provide a clear method for the procedures required to complete the customer's request for the service requested by the CX agent through WhatsApp.

sections.title: 05 Customer Privacy
sections.content:
05 Customer Privacy

· Provide a disclaimer stating that all messages are protected before initiating  the  conversation.

· Provide a message confirming that the WhatsApp number belongs to the entity.

sections.title: What are the Most Prominent General Standards that Need to be Achieved During Service Delivery?
sections.content:
What are the Most Prominent General Standards that Need to be Achieved During Service Delivery?

The entity must verify that the following standards  are applied to all of its communication channels:

· The service information is consistent across all the channels.

· The ability to follow up on the results of the service application through more than one channel/platform.

· The ability to apply for the service from one channel and obtain the service  from  another  channel.

· The service information regarding inquiry and application is consistent across all available channels.

· Provide and clarify the customer's journey through each channel with guiding  panels  or  a  video  on  electronic  screens  in  the  centres. Additionally,  provide  a  short  video  guide  regarding  the  steps  for submitting  a  service  request  through  digital  channels.

· The  ability  to  evaluate  the  quality  of  service  for  each  channel  and measure customer satisfaction  through  digital measurement tools, such as choosing an option from the happiness meter and adding a box  for  customer  comments  or  suggestions,  if  any.

· The ability to provide the geographical locations of the service centres on the available systems and applications.

· The ability to present the Customer Happiness Charter through the service  delivery  centres  across  all  their  channels.

· The  commitment  of  the  entity  providing  the  services  to  its  own corporate  identity  and  that  of  the  Emirate  of  Abu  Dhabi.
